events.name: How to Contribute to DevFest.Asia 2016
events.description:
All DevFest.Asia (2015+2016) contributors are invited :) Feel free to invite other potential organisers that might want to contribute!
Event Name speaks for itself - But basically, come listen to Thomas Gorissen talk...

P.S. Don't just be "interested" - click on that "going" button and JOIN US
events.location: The Spiffy Dapper, 73 Amoy Street, Singapore 069892

events.name: Making Talk
events.description: Hello! Please suggest somewhere in the West side of Singapore for a meetup. Personally, I am quite cheapo, so I don't mind a kopitiam somewhere, otherwise anywhere with coffee or beer can do too! Edit: we will meet at jurong East MRT kopitiam A few things to think about are: 1 - Do we actually need a space to make stuff? 2 - How can we create/find a cosy place near home, where we can make stuff? 3 - How would you like this group to be? 4 - What is your story? How did you start trying to make stuff? Don't be shy to comment on these questions before our meet in the comments section. It will be cool to meet with some awesome fun-loving people without travelling too much, so enjoy it! -Jerome
events.location: Jurong East MRT Kopitiam, Jurong East MRT, Singapore

events.name: On-going: Functional Programming in Scala Coursera Study Group
events.description: Study group for the Coursera Functional Programming in Scala Specialization, and all of it's courses.  Anyone may attend regardless of your progress in the courses.  We're here to help. If you have not already, please make sure that you have signed up for the courses you are interested in, on Coursera. <a>Functional Programming in Scala5-course Specialization·École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne</a> It's a good idea to have your development environment set up, before attending.  You can find instructions within the courses themselves.
events.location: Lowercase, 1 McNally St, Blk D #01-01, Singapore
